title: (x) bulging sans - Hobo {Nicolai}
content:
Please help me to ID this font, thank you very much in advance

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [a.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081015160631/http:/typophile.com/files/a_22.jpg) | 79.8 KB |

 [‹ (x) High Fashion 70's font - Pistilli Roman {Yves}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081015160631/http:/typophile.com/node/14362 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) 90s constructivist looking font - Modula {Dav} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081015160631/http:/typophile.com/node/14426 "Go to next forum topic")
author: contohabc

comments.content: It looks like someone did something to [Hobo](http://web.archive.org/web/20081015160631/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=LH.107999.0.1&attributes.sampleSize=144&sampleText=SA&sampleSize=288&attributes.paraSize=14&paraSize=14)

Pre-digital Hobo Black formed a nearly closed lower loop in the S like that, but I’m unaware of any digital version. [Hobo Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20081015160631/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=UR.109876.0.3&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=SA&sampleSize=288&attributes.paraSize=14&paraSize=14) might get you a bit closer, though, as far as the general weight and the counter in the A are concerned.
